plugins.name: Manu's Tools
plugins.description:
I'm creating these tools to improve my wife's workflow. More coming soon.


Available Tools

  1. Font Replacer: change all elements using font X to use font Y instead
  2. Element Selector: select all element with a given name


Coming Soon

  1. No ideas for now


I'm open to suggestions. If there's something you wish Figma allowed you to do let me know and I'll see what I can do.
plugins.tagline: Tools for my wife (and anyone else that finds them useful)

plugins.name: Lint copy
plugins.description:
Lint copy helps UX writers and content designers automatically enforce style rules with a custom word list.


Enforce things like plain language (e.g. detect "utilize" and suggest replacing it with "use"), the company's voice and tone (e.g. detect "we are" and suggest using the contraction), and even product terminology.


Create a custom word list in JSON and host it in a public GitHub repository to experience the plugin's full power.


The plugin also enforces sentence case and strings starting with a capital, neither of which is customizable.


For full details, read the documentation.
plugins.tagline: Check text layers against a word list to enforce style, voice, and terminology.

103128.name: Lint copy
103128.description:
Lint copy helps UX writers and content designers automatically enforce style rules with a custom word list.

Create a custom word list in JSON and host it in a public GitHub repository to experience the plugin's full power.


The plugin also enforces sentence case and strings starting with a capital, neither of which is customizable.


For full details, read the documentation.
103128.tagline: Check text layers against a word list to enforce style, voice, and terminology.

plugins.name: Wave Flag Insert Plugin
plugins.description:
Insert beautifully crafted country flags directly into your Figma designs with one click.


FlagPack SVG makes it easy to browse, search, and insert high-quality SVG flags into your design projects. Simply search for a country name, click on the flag, and it appears right on your canvasâ€”ready to scale, customize, or use as-is.


How to Use:


  1. Open the plugin in Figma.


  1. Use the search bar to find a specific flag.


  1. Click on any flag to insert it into your current page.


Done!


Ideal for UI mockups, dashboards, internationalization features, and travel apps.

accepted.name: Open Wave.io
accepted.description: Open Wave is an open-source organization Founded by Lawrence Okosa III. creating tools that streamline design and development workflows.

plugins.tagline: Drop any country flag into your design in seconds

plugins.name: TokenTidy
plugins.description: TokenTidy helps you quickly find frames, layers, and text in your Figma files that are missing design tokens. Scan selected frames and get a clean, organized report of elements missing fills, strokes, or typography styles. Perfect for teams standardizing their design systems or tidying up messy files. Save time, stay consistent, and ship polished designs with ease.
plugins.tagline: Spot unstyled elements instantly.

131180.name: TokenTidy
131180.description: TokenTidy helps you quickly find frames, layers, and text in your Figma files that are missing design tokens. Scan selected frames and get a clean, organized report of elements missing fills, strokes, or typography styles. Perfect for teams standardizing their design systems or tidying up messy files. Save time, stay consistent, and ship polished designs with ease.
131180.release_notes:
TokenTidy v1.0.2 â€“ UI & Accessibility Polish

Whatâ€™s new:
Success message now features a clear checkmark-in-circle icon in accessible green for better clarity and contrast.
All icons are larger and spacing is more visually balanced for a friendlier, more readable experience.
Improved padding and spacing in all feedback messages.
Warning and success messages are visually distinct and easy to understand.
All icons and colors pass accessibility contrast checks.
General UI polish and minor bug fixes.

Thank you for using TokenTidy! If you have feedback or suggestions, let us know.

plugins.name: Simple inspector
plugins.description:
CSS Extractor is a Figma plugin designed to help developers quickly extract CSS styles from selected elements and their children. It supports nested structures, text styles, image fills, and allows for easy image export. The UI provides options to copy the entire style block or individual style lines.


Key Features:


ðŸ” Display of selected elements and their child hierarchy.


ðŸŽ¨ Conversion of styles to CSS with unit selection: px or rem.


ðŸ“‹ Copy full CSS blocks or individual lines.


ðŸ–¼ Export image fills directly from elements.
plugins.tagline: Simple inspector css style copy and export source image

plugins.name: Change Variable Descriptions
plugins.description:
Tired of manually updating each Figma variableâ€™s description? This plugin streamlines the process by allowing you to update all variable descriptions simultaneously using a CSV file. This means you can ensure your design system stays consistent and well-documentedâ€”without the hassle of repetitive edits.


How It Works:


â€¢Prepare Your CSV: Create a CSV file with the format: token_name,description. Ensure each variable name in your CSV matches exactly (1:1) with the ones in Figma; the plugin is sensitive to misspellings and will skip any mismatches.

â€¢Select Variable Collection(s): Choose one or multiple variable collections based on your CSV file. (Recommendation: create a separate CSV for each collection.)

â€¢Preview Changes: Review the highlighted changes in a table before applying them, ensuring accuracy and control over the update process.

â€¢Apply Updates: With just a few clicks, update all selected variable descriptions in your Figma design system.


Streamline your design documentation, avoid manual errors, and keep your design tokens up-to-date effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Simplify workflow: Update variable descriptions in one click

126605.name: Change Variable Descriptions
126605.description:

This means you can ensure your design system stays consistent and well-documentedâ€”without the hassle of repetitive edits.


How It Works:


â€¢Prepare Your CSV: Create a CSV file with the format: token_name,description. Ensure each variable name in your CSV matches exactly (1:1) with the ones in Figma; the plugin is sensitive to misspellings and will skip any mismatches.

â€¢Select Variable Collection(s): Choose one or multiple variable collections based on your CSV file. (Recommendation: create a separate CSV for each collection.)

â€¢Preview Changes: Review the highlighted changes in a table before applying them, ensuring accuracy and control over the update process.

â€¢Apply Updates: With just a few clicks, update all selected variable descriptions in your Figma design system.


Streamline your design documentation, avoid manual errors, and keep your design tokens up-to-date effortlessly!
126605.tagline: Simplify workflow: Update variable descriptions in one click

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Asset Dependencies
plugins.description:
Effortlessly manage and visualize your Figma assets with the Asset Dependencies plugin. This powerful tool scans and analyzes your local Figma files, creating a topologically sorted list of all components, subcomponents, dependencies, and usage.


Comprehensive analysis

Automatically scans your Figma assets to identify all components and their relationships.


Topological sorting

Generates a clear, topologically sorted list of components and subcomponents, making it easy to understand dependencies.


Dependency mapping

Visualize which components are used by others, helping you manage and optimize your design system.


Usage insights

See at a glance how and where each component is used across your file.


Export options

Export lists as CSV files to use in other tools.

accepted.name: Elgato
accepted.description: Stream. Record. Create. | Empowering content creators since 2012

plugins.tagline: Get a list of dependencies for your local assets

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

110619.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
110619.description:

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.

plugins.description:

How it works

  1. Design frames in Figma and setup transitions using Smart Animate

  3. Use the HTML banner wherever you want


Why pay lots of money for other tools when you can just Fig2Ad.

plugins.name: Section Generator
plugins.description:
Allows you to create a large number of sections all at once. This is a great way to organize a handoff file with each row for different functionality or features.


Main section

Each main section is a row with a cover tile. The cover tile will be titled with the name you give. Main sections are stacked vertically.


Subsections

Configure the number of subsections you want per row. Subsections are spaced horizontally.


-> Allows you to include any number of desktop (1440) and mobile (390) screens

-> Each screen has a notes field below it for your annotations
plugins.tagline: Create sections of sections for an organized design handoff

108541.name: Section Generator
108541.description:

plugins.name: Figma Recall
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you save, manage, and switch between different versions (iterations) of your Figma frames.


Save an Iteration: Select a frame and click the Save button to save its current state.


Save with a Note: Hold Ctrl/Cmd and click the Save button to add a text description to your saved iteration.


Recall All Iterations: Select a frame and click the Recall button to view all its saved versions side-by-side.


Update Iterations: Make changes in the recalled container frame for any version and click Save to update with your changes in the stored master versions.


Navigate Versions: Use the < and > arrow buttons to cycle through saved iterations directly on your canvas.


Delete All Iterations: Select a frame and click the Delete button (trash icon) to remove all its saved versions.


Rename Iterations: Right-click the Save button to rename the selected frame and its entire group of saved iterations.
plugins.tagline: Version History but for Each Frame

138354.name: Figma Recall
138354.description:
This plugin lets you save, manage, and switch between different versions (iterations) of your Figma frames.


Save an Iteration: Select a frame and click the Save button to save its current state.


Save with a Note: Hold Ctrl/Cmd and click the Save button to add a text description to your saved iteration.


Recall All Iterations: Select a frame and click the Recall button to view all its saved versions side-by-side.


Update Iterations: Make changes in the recalled container frame for any version and click Save to update with your changes in the stored master versions.


Navigate Versions: Use the < and > arrow buttons to cycle through saved iterations directly on your canvas.


Delete All Iterations: Select a frame and click the Delete button (trash icon) to remove all its saved versions.


Rename Iterations: Right-click the Save button to rename the selected frame and its entire group of saved iterations.
138354.tagline: Version History but for Each Frame

plugins.name: Gulugulu Effect - create Glass Effects in one click
plugins.description: Inspired by iOS 26 and modern glassmorphism trends, Gulugulu Effect lets you instantly apply a frosted glass look to any layer in Figma. It uses background blur, semi-transparent fills, and soft gradient strokes to recreate that polished, liquid-glass UI feel. No need to tweak settings manually. Just select, click, and vibe. Perfect for designers who want sleek, minimal, futuristic interfaces â€” fast.
plugins.tagline: Turn any shape into pure iOS-style liquid glass â€” in one click.

plugins.name: Wireframe Pilot
plugins.description:
Description

Wireframe Pilot is a Figma plugin that lets you create beautiful, professional low-fi landing page wireframes for a wide range of industriesâ€”instantly. Choose from free, hardcoded industry templates or use AI to generate custom content and color schemes tailored to your business. Perfect for designers, agencies, and business owners who want to jumpstart their web projects with best-practice layouts and content.


Key Features

* One-click wireframe generation for 12+ industries (landscaping, tech, law, etc.)

* AI-powered content and color palette generation (with the option to use your own OpenAI API key)

* Customizable sections, layouts, and color schemes

* No coding requiredâ€”everything happens inside Figma


Instructions

1. Open the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Select your industry and customize sections, layouts, and colors as desired.

3. (Optional) Enter your OpenAI API key to unlock AI-powered content and color generation.

4. Click â€œGenerate Wireframeâ€ to add a complete landing page wireframe to your canvas.

5. Edit and iterate as needed!
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate modern, wireframes for landing pages within in Figma.

138266.name: Wireframe Pilot
138266.description:
Description

Wireframe Pilot is a Figma plugin that lets you create beautiful, professional low-fi landing page wireframes for a wide range of industriesâ€”instantly. Choose from free, hardcoded industry templates or use AI to generate custom content and color schemes tailored to your business. Perfect for designers, agencies, and business owners who want to jumpstart their web projects with best-practice layouts and content.


Key Features

* One-click wireframe generation for 12+ industries (landscaping, tech, law, etc.)

* AI-powered content and color palette generation (with the option to use your own OpenAI API key)

* Customizable sections, layouts, and color schemes

* No coding requiredâ€”everything happens inside Figma


Instructions

1. Open the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Select your industry and customize sections, layouts, and colors as desired.

3. (Optional) Enter your OpenAI API key to unlock AI-powered content and color generation.

4. Click â€œGenerate Wireframeâ€ to add a complete landing page wireframe to your canvas.

5. Edit and iterate as needed!

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs access to OpenAI's API for generating color schemes and content, Google Fonts for loading the Inter font family, and the custom backend for AI proxy.

138266.release_notes:
What's changed in this new version?

Interface Updates:
- Implemented a streamlined toggle switch for Basic/Pro mode selection
- Enhanced UI layout with improved visual hierarchy
- Optimized dialog interface for better Figma integration
- Refined input controls and button states

Technical Improvements:
- Enhanced accessibility compliance
- Optimized plugin initialization
- Refined error handling and user feedback

System Enhancements:
- Enhanced API key management system
- Improved visual feedback for system status
- Updated user interface components for better consistency
138266.tagline: Instantly generate modern, wireframes for landing pages within in Figma.

plugins.name: FigJsonizer
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you select any frame or component in Figma and instantly convert it into a clean, structured JSON object. It's perfect for devs building UI components, syncing data with code, or generating design specs.


No network needed, no fluffâ€”just fast, reliable JSON export from your Figma canvas. Copy the data to clipboard and use it wherever your workflow takes you: React, Angular, JSON-based APIsâ€”you name it.


Ideal for design-to-dev handoff, prototyping, and frontend engineering.
plugins.tagline: Generate and copy clean JSON from selected Figma frames.

133815.name: FigJsonizer
133815.description:
This plugin lets you select any frame or component in Figma and instantly convert it into a clean, structured JSON object. It's perfect for devs building UI components, syncing data with code, or generating design specs.


No network needed, no fluffâ€”just fast, reliable JSON export from your Figma canvas. Copy the data to clipboard and use it wherever your workflow takes you: React, Angular, JSON-based APIsâ€”you name it.


Ideal for design-to-dev handoff, prototyping, and frontend engineering.
133815.tagline: Generate and copy clean JSON from selected Figma frames.

plugins.name: Get Image Type
plugins.description:
A simple plugin that analyzes your selected images and reveals their file formats with a single click. Stop guessing if that asset is a JPG, PNG, SVG, or WebP.


Does not support:

  1. Video/Movie Files: This plugin does not support identification of video or movie formats.


Note: Figma automatically converts certain image formats during import. HEIC and TIFF/TIF files are converted to PNG format when imported into Figma, so the plugin will identify these as PNGs. This reflects the actual format of the image within Figma, not necessarily the original source format.

accepted.name: Farren Wang
accepted.description: Farren's Figma account. Here you'll find stuff she's proud of.

plugins.tagline: Identify the format of images in your Figma designs

136900.name: Get Image Type
136900.description:
A simple plugin that analyzes your selected images and reveals their file formats with a single click. Stop guessing if that asset is a JPG, PNG, SVG, or WebP.


Does not support:

  1. Video/Movie Files: This plugin does not support identification of video or movie formats.


Note: Figma automatically converts certain image formats during import. HEIC and TIFF/TIF files are converted to PNG format when imported into Figma, so the plugin will identify these as PNGs. This reflects the actual format of the image within Figma, not necessarily the original source format.
136900.tagline: Identify the format of images in your Figma designs

plugins.name: Pseudo Localizer for Figma & FigJam
plugins.description:
Design global-ready UIsâ€”without ever leaving Figma.


Skip the guesswork and see how your designs hold up in other languages, scripts, and text directionsâ€”instantly. With Pseudo Localizer, you can preview localized versions of your UI in seconds, directly inside Figma or FigJam. No setup, no logins, no external tools. Just you and your design.


â„¹ï¸ What you can do with Pseudo Localizer:


âœ… Preview global scripts instantly

Toggle between Latin, Cyrillic, CJK, and Arabic (RTL) with a single click.


âœ… Test layout resilience

Stretch or shrink text length from â€“50% to +50% to spot issues like clipping, wrapping, or misalignment.


âœ… Control the scope

Run it on a single button, a card, or the whole pageâ€”your call.


âœ… Keep it private & fast

Everything happens on your machine. No accounts, no external servers, no privacy worries.


â—ï¸Why it matters:


  1. Catch layout issues before they become bugs.
  2. Give your QA and localization teams better previews.
  3. Design smarter for a global audienceâ€”right from the start.


âš™ï¸ How it works:


  1. Select your screens with text layers (or don't select anything to pseudo translate the full page).
  2. Pick your script and text expansion.
  3. Click "Pseudotranslate"â€”done! A new page appears with your mocked-up, localized content (including RTL adjustments).


âœ¨ Ready to build for every language?

Install Pseudo Localizer from the Figma Community and see how your designs hold up across the globe.


ðŸ“¨ Got feedback? Share it here!

accepted.name: JosÃ© JÃ³vena CasaÃ±
accepted.description:
Helping teams make great design work everywhere.
Big on UX, localization, and making things clear across cultures.
Rookie Figma Plugin Author.

plugins.tagline: Instantly pseudotranslate your Figma designs to test global layoutsâ€”no setup, no accounts.

plugins.name: Legoify
plugins.description:
Turn any image or frame into stunning BLOCK-style artwork with just one click. Legoify automatically generates a perfect grid of glassmorphic BLOCK bricks that overlay your design, creating that iconic brick aesthetic instantly. Perfect for mockups, presentations, or adding a playful dimension to your projects. Unleash your inner brick artist without the tedious manual work.


Features:


  1. One-click LEGO transformation
  2. Auto-adapts to any image size
  3. Realistic brick detail with studs
  4. Glassmorphic effect for modern appeal
  5. Non-destructive editing (original preserved)


From photos to UI designsâ€”if you can select it, you can Legoify it!
plugins.tagline: One click brick or block effect generator

plugins.name: Easy Task Prioritiser
plugins.description:
Easy Task Prioritiserâ€¨Quickly organize and rank your tasks using two proven prioritization frameworks â€” right inside Figma.


âœ¨ How It Works

ðŸ”¢ Stack Ranking

Go to the Stack tab.

Enter your list of tasks.

Click Start Comparison to begin.

Youâ€™ll be shown two tasks at a time â€” choose which is more important.

Repeat until all tasks are compared and ranked.

In the end:

You'll get a clear, ranked list of tasks

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to bring the list into your Figma file


ðŸ§  MoSCoW Prioritization

Switch to the MoSCoW tab.

Add your tasks.

For each task, select whether itâ€™s a Must, Should, Could, or Wonâ€™t.

Once done, use Push to Canvas to generate a structured visual layout by category.

In the end:

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to see tasks grouped by priority


This plugin is perfect for product teams, designers, and facilitators who want to make prioritization decisions quickly â€” and stay focused on what matters most.
plugins.tagline: Turn messy task lists into clear priorities.

plugins.name: Frame Navigator
plugins.description:
ðŸ§­ FrameNavigator


Effortlessly navigate large and complex Figma files with FrameNavigator â€” a floating Table of Contents plugin that helps you stay organized and move between frames in a single click.


âœ¨ Key Features


- Quick Navigation

Instantly jump to any frame from a floating panel that stays visible while you work.


- Custom Frame Registration

Select frames directly on the canvas and add them to your TOC with a simple "+" button.


- Group Organization

Organize your frames into custom groups for better structure and clarityâ€”perfect for managing multiple screens.


- Flexible Panel Sizes

Choose between default, compact, and full views to match your workflow and screen space.


---


ðŸ›  How It Works


  1. Register a Frame: Select a frame on the Figma canvas and click the `+` button in the plugin to add it to the TOC.
  2. Create a Group: Hover over ungrouped frames in the TOC and click the appearing checkbox to select them. Then click the Create Group button at the top of the panel to group them.
  3. Add to Existing Group: Select a group first, then select a new frame on the canvas and click `+` to add the frame into that group.
  4. Rename a Group: Double-click on a group name to edit it.
  5. Remove a Group: Right-click on a group and select **Remove Group**. âš ï¸ Note: All frames inside that group will also be removed from the TOC.
  6. Reorder Frames: Drag and drop frames (or groups) within the TOC to change their order.


---


Perfect for design system creators, large prototyping flows, or anyone managing multi-screen layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly jump between frames with a floating table of contents. Easily build your own TOC.

Perfect for design system creators, large prototyping flows, or anyone managing multi-screen layouts in Figma.

plugins.name: QR Code Generator
plugins.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they donâ€™t rely on our service and theyâ€™re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.
plugins.tagline: Create QR codes without leaving Figma

126163.name: QR Code Generator
126163.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they donâ€™t rely on our service and theyâ€™re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin requires network access to RecodeQR's API to generate QR codes. No user data is stored.

126163.release_notes: Fixed dark mode, improve community details
126163.tagline: Create QR codes without leaving Figma

plugins.name: Find & Replace Anything
plugins.description:
Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!


A powerful tool for finding and replacing styles! Works with components, instances and library styles. Especially helpful to align parameters across projects in bulk like auto layout or library styles for your pixel perfect design.


Plugin is in active development. Therefore, any feedback is appreciated! Like our plugin? Leave a heart!


Full feature list:


Library & local Styles

  1. Fonts
  2. Colors
  3. Effects
  4. Grids


Variables (search only)

  1. Color Variable
  2. Number Variable
  3. String Variable
  4. Boolean Variable


Shape & Frame

  1. Name
  2. Width
  3. Height
  4. Position X
  5. Position Y
  6. Rotation
  7. Constrain Proportions
  8. Clip content


Text

  1. Text
  2. Font Size
  3. Paragraphs Spacing
  4. Paragraph Indent
  5. Text Decoration
  6. Text Case
  7. Text Resizing
  8. Text Align Horizontal
  9. Text Align Vertical


Layer

  1. Blend Mode
  2. Opacity
  3. Visibility


Stroke

  1. Stroke Align
  2. Stroke Weight
  3. Stroke Join


Auto Layout

  1. Layout mode
  2. Spacing between items
  3. Paddings
plugins.tagline: Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!

plugins.name: Magnetic Snap
plugins.description:
You can align multiple selected objects horizontally or vertically with no gaps (0px spacing).


When aligning horizontally, objects are placed from left to right, and when aligning vertically, objects are placed from top to bottom. Setting a keyboard shortcut allows you to align objects more quickly than setting 0 pixels of space in Auto Layout.

plugins.name: CheckMate (community)
plugins.description:
A simple way to track use of Design System components in your projects! Tracking of projects' scoring helps:


  1. Maintain a product's UX consistency across projects.
  2. Design System (Global & Domain Libraries) to grow to meet evolving needs.
  3. Designers & Domains to make visible their progression in the practice and use of Design System to improve UX consistency and work efficiency.
plugins.tagline: A simple way to track use of Design System components in your projects

plugins.name: Move Outside
plugins.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the pageâ€™s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
plugins.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.

plugins.name: Remote Variable Replacer
plugins.description:
Sometimes Figma variables arenâ€™t coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or â€œremoteâ€, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components donâ€™t seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
plugins.tagline: Replace those pesky remote variables!

135284.name: Remote Variable Replacer
135284.description:
Sometimes Figma variables arenâ€™t coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or â€œremoteâ€, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components donâ€™t seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
135284.release_notes:
Improved the dropdowns for numerical variables to only show local variables whose base value match the remote variable base value. This should make the plugin easy to navigate if a user has hundreds of variables.

Removed beta language; Included network access for tailwind for easy stying and unpkg.com for React. This should fix the blank screen of death. Rookie mistake!

Also updated the data security details to let users know the network access is only for static items.
